hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com

Class ComHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com.ComHandler

  • public class ComHandler
extends Object
    ComHandler handles the communication with an object of IOType. The class takes a vector of ICommand objects, prepares its content internally, and sends the prepared commands to the previously specified i/o port.

    Using ComHandler requires the following steps:

    1. Getting an object of class ComHandler
    ComHandler is implemented as a singleton. An object of this class can be acquired using the method getInstance()

    2. Defining a communication port
    The communication port is an implementation of the interface IOType and is provided to the ComHandler instance using the start(Vector, IOType) method. In case the commands shall be send to a wifi port, first, the communication port has to be determined using the WiFiCardHandler.

    3. Registering to ComHandler
    The registration to the ComHandler is based on the IComListener interface. In order to retrieve information (here: which command is actually executed) from the actually process, ComHandler implements an event model (cp. JButton and ActionListener). This means, the class which uses the ComHandler has to register itself to the ComHandler before starting the control process execution. Therefore, the class has to implement the IComListener interface and calls the method register(IComListener). After starting the execution process ComHandler will inform the class calling the method IComListener.commandPerformed(ICommand) of the interface {link hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com.IComListener}. When calling this method ComHandler provides the actual executed command in form of an ICommand object.

    4. Starting and stopping the execution process
    For starting and stopping the execution of the command process ComHandler provides the methods start(Vector, IOType) and stop().
    See Also:
    WiFiCardHandler, WiFiCard, IComListener, ICommand, WiFi
